title: The same people who keep chanting "Give us a tank meta!"...
body:
...are the ones who say Poppy being strong is cancer...

http://i.imgur.com/IH4fZyx.gif?1

...so one of the best specimens of a tank(beside Sion) being too strong cancer, but you want a meta *full* of unkillable walls of ambient damage being played in 2-4 roles on each team?

Sorry, I don't want a tank meta, or an ADC meta, or a lethality meta. I want a healthy and balanced meta. Where having a tank or two on your team is viable and valuable, but no single class is crowding out all the others. 

Then again, during every tank meta people scream for it to end...
https://img.chinalovematch.net/files/blog/image/479/201104252330130546742.jpg

The perception of what a tank meta is kinda varies from player to player.

For some seeing 1 tank and 2 others being fairly tanky would be considered a tank meta.

Although to be fair, most of those "marksman metas" have had 1 marksman per team. In that case, we've been in a mage meta for quite a while as well, considering that mages have been more popular than assassins for a while now. Not only that, we could call most of League's history a tank meta, as typically teams will take at least one tank to be a front liner, either from top or jungle. A meta tends to imply a regular cycle of more than one of a class per team.

I do *not* like being one of 3 ambient walls of damage slowly mowing over 3 ambient walls of damage while an ADC and Mage dance around pretending to be relevant. It is no healthier than the meta where ADCs were in 3-4 roles every game.
